archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Apple-Onion Pork Chops with Barley Pilaf and Sautéed Cabbage
description: Seared pork chops roasted with apples and onions, finished with a light pan sauce. Served with herbed barley pilaf and buttery sautéed cabbage and carrots for a family-friendly, low-sodium comfort dinner.
prep_steps: Pat dry pork chops; set out to temper 10 minutes.
Core and slice apple into thin wedges.
Rinse barley under cold water and drain.
In a small cup, mix 1 tablespoon flour with 2 tablespoons water to make a smooth slurry.
cook_steps: Start barley: Warm 1 teaspoon olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add barley and toast 1 minute, stirring.
Add 2 1/2 cups water and 1 bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer, cover, and cook 25–30 minutes until tender. Keep covered off heat.
Sear pork: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Season pork chops on both sides with black pepper, a pinch of thyme, and a pinch of rosemary.
Add pork chops to the skillet and sear 2–3 minutes per side until well browned.

Add onion and apple to the skillet around the chops; scatter in half the minced garlic. Transfer skillet to the oven and roast 8–12 minutes, until pork reaches 145°F (63°C). Transfer chops to a plate and tent loosely.

Make pan sauce: Return the skillet to medium heat. Add 1/3 cup white wine and simmer 1–2 minutes, scraping browned bits. Stir in 1/2 cup vegetable stock and reduce 2–3 minutes. Whisk in the flour slurry and simmer 1 minute until lightly thickened. Swirl in 1 tablespoon butter. Adjust black pepper to taste.

Sauté cabbage: In a separate large skillet, melt 1 tablespoon butter with 1 teaspoon olive oil over medium heat. Add cabbage and carrots; cook 5–7 minutes, tossing, until tender-crisp. Add remaining garlic in the last minute. Finish with a squeeze of lemon and black pepper.
Finish barley: Remove bay leaf. Fluff barley with a fork and fold in parsley and a squeeze of lemon.
Plate chops with the apples and onions on top. Spoon pan sauce over. Serve with barley pilaf and sautéed cabbage and carrots.
